client_password.description: The username to authenticate against Foreman. This can also be set through the environment variable `FOREMAN_CLIENT_PASSWORD`. Defaults to `""`.

client_tls_insecure.description: Whether or not to verify the server's certificate. Defaults to `false`.

client_username.description: The username to authenticate against Foreman. This can also be set through the environment variable `FOREMAN_CLIENT_USERNAME`. Defaults to `""`.

provider_logfile.description: Where to deirect provider-specific log output. A value of '-' preserves the default behavior of the log package from Golang stdlib and will be combined with the main terraform.log file produced by terraform. If the desired output file does not exist, it will be created. If the file already exists, logs will be appended to the file. This can also be set through the enviornment variable `FOREMAN_PROVIDER_LOGFILE`. Defaults to `'terraform-provider-foreman.log'`.

provider_loglevel.description: The level of verbosity for the provider's log file. This setting determines which types of log messages are written and which are ignored. Possible values (from most verbose to least verbose) include 'DEBUG', 'TRACE', 'INFO', 'WARNING', 'ERROR', and 'NONE'.  The provider's logs will be written to the location specified by `provider_logfile`. This can also be set through the environment variable `FOREMAN_PROVIDER_LOGLEVEL`. Defaults to `'INFO'`.

server_hostname.description: The hostname / IP address of the Foreman REST API server. This can also be set through the environment variable `FOREMAN_SERVER_HOSTNAME`.

server_protocol.description: The protocol the Foreman REST API server is using for communication. Defaults to `"https"`.

__meta__.description: @SUMMARY Foreman representation of an instruction set architecture (ISA).

name.description: The name of the architecture. Valid characters: ^[A-Za-z0-9-_.]+$. @EXAMPLE "i386"

operatingsystem_ids.description: IDs of the operating systems associated with this architecture

bmc_success.description: Tracks the partial state of BMC operations on host creation. If these operations fail, the host will be created in Foreman and this boolean will remain `false`. On the next `terraform apply` will trigger the host update to pick back up with the BMC operations. @UNEXPORTED

comment.description: Add additional information about this host.

domain_id.description: ID of the domain to assign to the host.

enable_bmc.description: Enables PMI/BMC functionality. On create and update calls, having this enabled will force a host to poweroff, set next boot to PXE and power on. Defaults to `false`.

environment_id.description: ID of the environment to assign to the host.

hostgroup_id.description: ID of the hostgroup to assign to the host.

managed.description: Whether or not this host is marked as managed by Foreman.

name.description: Host fully qualified domain name. @EXAMPLE "compute01.dc1.company.com"

operatingsystem_id.description: ID of the operating system to put on the host.

retry_count.description: Number of times to retry on a failed attempt to register a new host in foreman.

identifier.description: Identifier of this interface local to the host.

ip.description: IP address associated with the interface.

mac.description: MAC address associated with the interface.

managed.description: Whether or not this interface is managed by Foreman.

password.description: Associated password used for BMC/IPMI functionality.

primary.description: Whether or not this is the primary interface.

provider.description: Provider used for BMC/IMPI functionality. Values include: `"IPMI"`

provision.description: Whether or not this interface is used to provision the host.

subnet_id.description: ID of the subnet to associate with this interface.

type.description: The type of interface. Values include: `"interface"`, `"bmc"`, `"bond"`, `"bridge"`.

virtual.description: Whether or not this is a virtual interface.

__meta__.description: @SUMMARY Hostgroups are organized in a tree-like structure and inherit values from their parent hostgroup(s). When hosts get associated with a hostgroup, it will inherit attributes from the hostgroup. This allows for easy, shared configuration of various hosts based on common attributes.

architecture_id.description: ID of the architecture associated with this hostgroup.

compute_profile_id.description: ID of the compute profile associated with this hostgroup.

domain_id.description: ID of the domain associated with this hostgroup.

environment_id.description: ID of the environment associated with this hostgroup.

medium_id.description: ID of the media associated with this hostgroup.

name.description: Hostgroup name. @EXAMPLE "compute"

operatingsystem_id.description: ID of the operating system associated with this hostgroup.

ptable_id.description: ID of the partition table associated with this hostgroup.

puppet_ca_proxy_id.description: ID of the smart proxy acting as the puppet certificate authority server for this hostgroup.

puppet_proxy_id.description: ID of the smart proxy acting as the puppet proxy server for this hostgroup.

realm_id.description: ID of the realm associated with this hostgroup.

subnet_id.description: ID of the subnet associated with the hostgroup.

title.description: The title is the fullname of the hostgroup.  A hostgroup's title is a path-like string from the head of the hostgroup tree down to this hostgroup.  The title will be in the form of: "<parent 1>/<parent 2>/.../<name>".

name.description: Name of the media. @EXAMPLE "CentOS mirror"

operatingsystem_ids.description: IDs of the operating systems associated with this media.

path.description:
The path to the medium, can be a URL or a valid NFS server (exclusive of the architecture).  For example:

http://mirror.centos.org/centos/$version/os/$arch

Where $arch will be substituted for the host's actual OS architecture and $version, $major, $minor will be substituted for the version of the operating system. 

Solaris and Debian media may also use $release. @EXAMPLE "http://mirror.averse.net/centos/$major.$minor/os/$arch"

hardware_model.description: Name of the specific hardware model.

info.description: Additional information about this hardware model.

name.description: The name of the hardware model. @EXAMPLE "PowerEdge FC630"

vendor_class.description: Name or class of the hardware vendor.

__meta__.description: @SUMMARY The disk partition layout of the host.

audit_comment.description: Any audit comments to associate with the partition table. The audit comment field is saved with the template auditing to document the template changes.

host_ids.description: IDs of the hosts associated with this partition table.

hostgroup_ids.description: IDs of the hostgroups associated with this partition table.

layout.description: The script that defines the partition table layout. @EXAMPLE "void"

locked.description: Whether or not this partition table is locked for editing.

name.description: The name of the partition table. @EXAMPLE "AutoYaST LVM"

operatingsystem_ids.description: IDs of the operating system associated with this partition table.

snippet.description: Whether or not this partition table is a snippet to be embedded in other partition tables.

__meta__.description: @SUMMARY Provisioning templates are scripts used to describe how to bootstrap and install the operating system on the host.

audit_comment.description: Notes and comments for auditing purposes.

locked.description: Whether or not the template is locked for editing.

name.description: Name of the provisioning template. @EXAMPLE "AutoYaST default"

operatingsystem_ids.description: IDs of the operating systems associated with this provisioning template.

snippet.description: Whether or not the provisioning template is a snippet be used by other templates.

template.description: The markup and code of the provisioning template. @EXAMPLE "void"

template_kind_id.description: ID of the template kind which categorizes the provisioning template. Optional for snippets, otherwise required.

environment_id.description: The environment ID for this template combination.

hostgroup_id.description: The hostgroup ID for this template combination.

__meta__.description: @SUMMARY Smart proxies provide an API for a higher-level orchestration tool. Foreman supports the following smart proxies: DHCP (ISC DHCP & MS DHCP servers), DNS (bind & MS DNS servers), Puppet >= 0.24.x, Puppet CA, Realm (FreeIPA), Templates, TFTP.

name.description: The name of the smart proxy. @EXAMPLE "dns.dc1.company.com"

url.description: Uniform resource locator of the proxy. @EXAMPLE "https://dns.dc1.company.com:8443"

__meta__.description: @SUMMARY Foreman representation of an instruction set architecture (ISA).

name.description: The name of the architecture. @EXAMPLE "x86_64"

operatingsystem_ids.description: IDs of the operating systems associated with this architecture

__meta__.description: @SUMMARY Foreman representation of domain. Domains serve as an identification string that defines autonomy, authority, or control for a portion of a network.

name.description: The name of the domain - the full DNS domain name. @EXAMPLE "dev.dc1.company.com"
The name of the puppet branch, environment. @EXAMPLE "production"

__meta__.description: @SUMMARY Hostgroups are organized in a tree-like structure and inherit values from their parent hostgroup(s). When hosts get associated with a hostgroup, it will inherit attributes from the hostgroup. This allows for easy, shared configuration of various hosts based on common attributes.

architecture_id.description: ID of the architecture associated with this hostgroup.

compute_profile_id.description: ID of the compute profile associated with this hostgroup.

domain_id.description: ID of the domain associated with this hostgroup.

environment_id.description: ID of the environment associated with this hostgroup.

medium_id.description: ID of the media associated with this hostgroup.

name.description: Hostgroup name. @EXAMPLE "compute"

operatingsystem_id.description: ID of the operating system associated with this hostgroup.

ptable_id.description: ID of the partition table associated with this hostgroup.

puppet_ca_proxy_id.description: ID of the smart proxy acting as the puppet certificate authority server for this hostgroup.

puppet_proxy_id.description: ID of the smart proxy acting as the puppet proxy server for this hostgroup.

realm_id.description: ID of the realm associated with this hostgroup.

subnet_id.description: ID of the subnet associated with the hostgroup.

title.description: The title is the fullname of the hostgroup.  A hostgroup's title is a path-like string from the head of the hostgroup tree down to this hostgroup.  The title will be in the form of: "<parent 1>/<parent 2>/.../<name>". @EXAMPLE "BO1/VM/DEVP4"

name.description: Name of the media. @EXAMPLE "Debian mirror"

operatingsystem_ids.description: IDs of the operating systems associated with this media.

path.description:
The path to the medium, can be a URL or a valid NFS server (exclusive of the architecture).  For example:

http://mirror.centos.org/centos/$version/os/$arch

Where $arch will be substituted for the host's actual OS architecture and $version, $major, $minor will be substituted for the version of the operating system. 

Solaris and Debian media may also use $release. @EXAMPLE "http://mirror.averse.net/centos/$major.$minor/os/$arch"

hardware_model.description: Name of the specific hardware model.

info.description: Additional information about this hardware model.

name.description: The name of the hardware model. @EXAMPLE "PowerEdge C8220"

vendor_class.description: Name or class of the hardware vendor.

__meta__.description: @SUMMARY Foreman representation of an operating system.

name.description: Operating system name. @EXAMPLE "CentOS"

password_hash.description: Root password hash function to use. Valid values include: `"MD5"`, `"SHA256"`, `"SHA512"`, `"Base64"`.

release_name.description: Code name or release name for the specific operating system version.

title.description: Title is a Foreman computed property that combines the operating system's name, major, and minor versioning information into a single string. @EXAMPLE "CentOS 7.5"

__meta__.description: @SUMMARY The disk partition layout of the host.

audit_comment.description: Any audit comments to associate with the partition table. The audit comment field is saved with the template auditing to document the template changes.

host_ids.description: IDs of the hosts associated with this partition table.

hostgroup_ids.description: IDs of the hostgroups associated with this partition table.

layout.description: The script that defines the partition table layout. @EXAMPLE "void"

locked.description: Whether or not this partition table is locked for editing.

name.description: The name of the partition table. @EXAMPLE "Wayfair CentOS 7"

operatingsystem_ids.description: IDs of the operating system associated with this partition table.

snippet.description: Whether or not this partition table is a snippet to be embedded in other partition tables.

__meta__.description: @SUMMARY Provisioning templates are scripts used to describe how to bootstrap and install the operating system on the host.

audit_comment.description: Notes and comments for auditing purposes.

locked.description: Whether or not the template is locked for editing.

name.description: The name of the provisioning template. @EXAMPLE "ESXi 6.0 Kickstart - BO1"

operatingsystem_ids.description: IDs of the operating systems associated with this provisioning template.

snippet.description: Whether or not the provisioning template is a snippet be used by other templates.

template.description: The markup and code of the provisioning template. @EXAMPLE "void"

template_combinations_attributes.description:
How templates are determined:

When editing a template, you must assign a list of operating systems which this template can be used with.  Optionally, you can restrict a template to a list of host groups and/or environments.

When a host requests a template, Foreman will select the best match from the available templates of that type in the following order:

  1. host group and environment
  2. host group only
  3. environment only
  4. operating system default

Template combinations attributes contains an array of hostgroup IDs and environment ID combinations so they can be used in the provisioning template selection described above.

template_kind_id.description: ID of the template kind which categorizes the provisioning template. Optional for snippets, otherwise required.

__meta__.description: @SUMMARY Smart proxies provide an API for a higher-level orchestration tool. Foreman supports the following smart proxies: DHCP (ISC DHCP & MS DHCP servers), DNS (bind & MS DNS servers), Puppet >= 0.24.x, Puppet CA, Realm (FreeIPA), Templates, TFTP.

name.description: The name of the smart proxy. @EXAMPLE "dns.dc1.company.com"

url.description: Uniform resource locator of the proxy. @EXAMPLE "https://dns.dc1.company.com:8443"

boot_mode.description: Default boot mode for instances assigned to this subnet. Values include: `"Static"`, `"DHCP"`.

dns_primary.description: Primary DNS server for this subnet.

dns_secondary.description: Secondary DNS sever for this subnet.

from.description: Start IP address for IP auto suggestion.

gateway.description: Gateway server to use when connecting/communicating to anything not on the same network.

ipam.description: IP address auto-suggestion for this subnet. Valid values include: `"DHCP"`, `"Internal DB"`, `"None"`.

name.description: Subnet name. @EXAMPLE "10.228.247.0 BO1"

to.description: Ending IP address for IP auto suggestion.

name.description: Type of template. @EXAMPLE "PXELinux"
